Write Snapshot File to Disk

Source: R/UrlScraper_utils_snapshots.R
dot-write_snapshot.Rd

Saves a data snapshot (data.table) to the specified snapshot directory, naming it with the chunk ID and a timestamp. This is typically called during batched scraping operations to persist intermediate results.

Usage

.write_snapshot(dt, chunk_id, snapshot_dir)

Arguments

dt

A data.table containing scraped data and extracted links.

chunk_id

integer(1) Identifier of the current chunk. Used in file naming as snap_chunkXX_*.

snapshot_dir

character(1) Directory where the snapshot file will be written.

Value

invisible(NULL). The function writes a .rds file as a side effect.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
dt <- data.table::data.table(
  url = "https://example.com",
  scraped_at = Sys.time(),
  html = "<html></html>"
)

.write_snapshot(dt, chunk_id = 1, snapshot_dir = "snapshots/")
} # }
